title: Engineer/Scientist III with Security Clearance
job_description: Job DescriptionWould you love to work for a fast-growing company with amazing perks and benefits including educational and professional development and a great Work-Life balance? Then Forward Slope wants you to join our team! We are a fast-paced global engineering company with a great reputation in the Department of Defense industry for over 20 years. Forward Slope currently has a full-time position for an Engineer/Scientist III to join our Global Security and Engineering Solutions Team. This position is located in Charleston, SC. Job Description: Conduct systems analysis activities to evaluate the performance, functionality, and interoperability of C4ISR (Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance) systems, identifying areas for improvement and optimization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop comprehensive systems architectures that align with operational requirements and technological capabilities, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security. Provide technical support for systems and equipment related to C4ISR, including troubleshooting issues, performing diagnostics, and implementing solutions to maintain operational readiness. Assist in the planning, execution, and analysis of test and evaluation activities to validate the performance, reliability, and effectiveness of C4ISR systems under various operational conditions and scenarios. Support logistics activities associated with C4ISR requirements, including procurement, inventory management, maintenance planning, and equipment deployment, to ensure timely and efficient support to end-users. Utilize technical expertise in Global Command and Control System - Maritime/Joint (GCCS-M/J), Tactical Data Links, or Broad Spectrum Communications to contribute to the design, implementation, and optimization of related systems and capabilities. Collaborate with senior engineers, scientists, and project managers to develop and implement innovative solutions that address complex technical challenges and enhance C4ISR capabilities. Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices related to C4ISR systems and technologies, actively participating in professional development activities and knowledge-sharing initiatives. Provide technical guidance and support to junior staff members, sharing knowledge and experience to foster their professional growth and development within the organization. Maintain accurate documentation, including technical reports, system specifications, and configuration management records, to ensure compliance with established standards and regulatory requirements. Participate in meetings, working groups, and technical reviews to communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders, including internal teams, clients, and partners. Adhere to established quality assurance processes and safety protocols, promoting a culture of continuous improvement and adherence to best practices within the organization. The duties and responsibilities outlined above are indicative and may evolve based on project requirements, organizational priorities, and individual capabilities. The Engineer/Scientist III is expected to demonstrate initiative, adaptability, and a commitment to excellence in supporting C4ISR initiatives and objectives. Required Qualifications: BS degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Management Information Systems, or related field. Six (6) years of experience in "C4ISR Systems", to include:Systems Analysis, Systems Architecture, Systems/Equipment Support, Test and Evaluation, and Logistics support of C4ISR requirements. Three (3) years of technical experience in support of C4ISR, GCCS-(M/J), Tactical DataLinks, or Broad Spectrum Communications. Overseas travel may be required. Desired Qualification: Professional Software Engineering Master (PSEM)/ Certified Software Development Professional (CSDP) or with COR approval complete Vendor/platform specific certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer (MCSD), Microsoft Certified Applications Developer (MCAD), Microsoft Certified Database Administrator (MCDBA), Sun Certified Professional (SCP), Red Hat Certification Program (RHCP), CISCO Certified Network Professional (CCNP), Oracle Certified Professional (OCP), other). Other Requirements: DOD contracts specify US Citizens. Candidate must have an active Security Clearance at the SECRET level. *Salary Range: $100,000 - $140,000Job Type: Full-Time Salary Why Join Forward Slope? Fast-paced global company with a great reputation in the DoD industry for over 20 years Telework option available Flexible working hours based on job needs Great and fun work culture Amazing benefits package for full time employees (including 90% employer contribution for employee medical benefits) 3 weeks of PTO a year 11 paid company holidays a year Team Building - Continuous appreciation events for our employees Education and Professional Development – programs to help you with your educational and professional growth! Forward Slope is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. *The listed pay scale reflects the broad, minimum to maximum, pay scale for this position for the location for which it has been posted and is not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Other compensation considerations may include, but are not limited to, job responsibilities, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, or other applicable factors. **PAY TRANSPARENCY NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION - The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c). Company Information:Forward Slope, Inc. (FSI) is a technology and services company that is a recognized reliable partner. Established in 2002, FSI has a nationwide presence and is a quality services provider driven by a commitment to superior technical leadership, collaborative work environments, customer driven cultures, and daily client interactions. FSI provides complex business solutions and delivers “Best in Class” technology and services solutions which includes customer satisfaction as a priority. We deliver products and service solutions on time and within budget to the U.S. government and enterprise customers that exceed expectations in three key areas: Defense Technologies, Enterprise Technologies, and Professional Services. In addition, FSI is an SEI-appraised CMMI Maturity Level (ML) 3 organization. For more information about our company, visit our website at https://www.forwardslope.com https://forwardslope.applicantstack.com/x/detail/a2wdpuzqly1s

title: Lead Software Engineer, Back End (AWS, Java, Python)
job_description: 77 West Wacker Dr (35012), United States of America, Chicago, IllinoisLead Software Engineer, Back End (AWS, Java, Python)Do you love building and pioneering in the technology space? At Capital One, you'll be part of a big group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We are seeking Back End Software Engineers who are passionate about marrying data with emerging technologies. As a Capital One Software Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to be on the forefront of driving a major transformation within Capital One.What You’ll Do:  Lead a portfolio of diverse technology projects and a team of developers with deep experience in distributed microservices, and full stack systems to create solutions that help meet regulatory needs for the company  Share your passion for staying on top of tech trends, experimenting with and learning new technologies, participating in internal & external technology communities, mentoring other members of the engineering community, and from time to time, be asked to code or evaluate code  Collaborate with digital product managers, and deliver robust cloud-based solutions that drive powerful experiences to help millions of Americans achieve financial empowerment  Utilize programming languages like Java, Python, SQL, Node, Go, and Scala, Open Source RDBMS and NoSQL databases, Container Orchestration services including Docker and Kubernetes, and a variety of AWS tools and services Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree  At least 6 years of professional software engineering experience (Internship experience does not apply)  At least 1 year experience with cloud computing (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) Preferred Qualifications: Master's Degree  7+ years of experience in at least one of the following: Java, Scala, Python, Go, or Node.js  2+ years of experience with AWS, GCP, Azure, or another cloud service  4+ years of experience in open source frameworks  1+ years of people management experience  2+ years of experience in Agile practices At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website . Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days.No agencies please. title: DevOps Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: The DevOps System Integrator will be a member of the Software Defined Radio Solutions (SDRS) Integrated Product Team (IPT). The SDRS IPT develops products for multiple government agencies, including the Office of Naval Research Future Naval Capabilities. Automates existing software builds into a mature CI/CD pipeline which implements repeatable builds and deployments including integration of industry best practices of built-in-quality and built-in-security Participates in code reviews as both an author (of automation scripts and infrastructure as code solutions) and a reviewer Supports the installation of GOTS, COTS and product specific software onto various computing devices Provisions equipment for product test labs and field demonstrations. Assists with logistics for hardware related to field demonstrations, including inventory, packaging, shipping, tear down and rebuild before and after demo Works with System Engineers to confirm and audit that hardware systems are provisioned in accordance with the system design model * Works with Cyber Security experts to make sure systems maintain a hardened security posture Requirements MINIMUM SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 8 years of job-related experience or equivalent Four (4) years or more years direct experience with: * DevOps Linux software development environments Demonstrated ability to understand and manage container-based software systems Experience with one or more Scripting languages Excellent communications, organization, and analytical skills US citizen with active DoD Secret clearanceDESIRED SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: Experience with linux container creation, management, security, and operations tools such as Docker, Singularity, Buildah, Podman, Kubernetes, Helm, Trivy, Clair Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Ansible, Vagrant, Terraform * Experience with Linux Operating Systems and System provisioning of physical machines, virtual machines, and edge devices Experience Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment tools and solutions including systems such as Gitlab CI/CD, Make, Jenkins, Maven, Artifactory, Nexus Experience working on and Agile or Scrum team Experience with Code Analysis tools and such as SonarQube and Fortify Experience with standard Software Configuration Management tools and practices (Git, Jira, Confluence, etc.) Experience with standard government Cyber Security methods and tools (STIGs, ACAS scans) Security+ certification or the ability to obtain certification within 6 months of employmentSRC IS A CONTRACTOR FOR THE U.S. GOVERNMENT, THIS POSITION WILL REQUIRE U.S. CITIZENSHIP AS WELL AS, A U.S. GOVERNMENT SECURITY CLEARANCE AT THE SECRET LEVEL ABOUT US Scientific Research Corporation is an advanced information technology and engineering company that provides innovative products and services to government and private industry, as well as independent institutions. At the core of our capabilities is a seasoned team of highly skilled engineers and scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds. This team is challenged daily to provide cutting edge technology solutions to our clients. Scientific Research Corporation offers a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages excellence. For positions requiring a security clearance, selected applicants will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. DIVERSITY & INCLUSION We strongly believe in the abundance of differences among individuals. We value different points of view and appreciate diverse perspectives. We truly believe this is what makes our organization inclusive and more responsive to the needs of our diverse customers. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Scientific Research Corporation is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate in employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Scientific Research Corporation endeavors to make www.scires.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact for assistance. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. [#CJ ]

title: Full Stack Software Developer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: We are seeking a skilled Full Stack Developer to join our team. As a Full Stack Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining web applications that meet our clients' needs. You should have a strong understanding of both front-end and back-end technologies and be able to work collaboratively within a team. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications Designs, develops, tests, and deploys web applications using both front-end and back-end technologies Creates and maintains database schemas, models, and queries Implements user authentication and authorization systems Collaborates with UI/UX designers to ensure seamless integration of design and functionality Troubleshoots and debugs issues across the application stack Optimizes applications for maximum speed and scalability Stays updated with industry trends and best practices to suggest improvements and innovative solutions Requirements MINIMUM SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience) Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer, with knowledge of a combination of the following technologies: * Front-end: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular, or Vue.js Back-end: Node.js, Express, Python, Ruby on Rails, or similar Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or similar Understanding of RESTful API design and development Proficiency in version control systems (e.g., Git) Strong problem-solving and debugging skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environmentDESIRED SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Knowledge of microservices architecture Understanding of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes) Familiarity with testing frameworks and continuous integration practices Proficiency in additional programming languages such as Java, C#, PHP, or Python Experience with responsive design and cross-browser compatibility Experience with real-time communication technologies like Channels, Socket.io, or Pusher. Familiarity with mapping libraries such as Leaflet.js, ArcGIS, or Mapbox GL JS. Expertise in designing and consuming RESTful APIs. Knowledge of email integration and handling within web applications. Experience with version control using Git. Familiarity with containerization and deployment using Docker. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues. Knowledge of authentication and authorization mechanisms. Strong understanding of web security best practices. Excellent teamwork and communication skills. Self-motivated and eager to learn about new technologies and tools. Experience with CI/CD pipelines and continuous integration tools is a plus. Familiarity with data synchronization concepts is a plus.SRC IS A CONTRACTOR FOR THE U.S. GOVERNMENT, THIS POSITION WILL REQUIRE U.S. CITIZENSHIP AND ELIGIBILITY FOR A U.S. GOVERNMENT SECURITY CLEARANCE AT THE SECRET LEVEL ABOUT US Scientific Research Corporation is an advanced information technology and engineering company that provides innovative products and services to government and private industry, as well as independent institutions. title: Sr Research Engineer - Advanced Technology & Rapid Prototyping with Security Clearance
job_description: TitleSr Research Engineer - Advanced Technology & Rapid Prototyping Location: North Charleston SC, San Diego, CA, DC/metro Area with flexibility with remote and hybrid teleworking. Job Description: KBR is a leading provider of innovative solutions for defense, technology, and information systems, specializing in advanced technology experimentation and integration. We work closely with government agencies, including the Department of Defense (DoD), to deliver cutting-edge solutions that enhance national security and technological capabilities. Job Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Research Engineer to lead research, analysis, and development efforts in C4ISR systems integration and autonomous technologies. The Senior Research Engineer will focus on designing, developing, and integrating advanced technologies to ensure system security, cyber-resiliency, and operational effectiveness across a range of defense applications. Key Responsibilities: C4ISR Systems Integration: * Research, analyze, and assess integration of C4ISR and sensor systems and subsystems. Develop prototype deployable communications, datalink, and sensor systems. Implement and verify communication capability between devices, databases, and services with Government approval. Cybersecurity and Resilience: * Assess system security and cyber-resiliency throughout the life cycle of C4ISR systems. Develop recommendations for security controls, vulnerability assessments, and risk mitigation strategies. Research and recommend a standardized framework for C4ISR products and cyber operations reporting. Autonomous Technologies: * Conduct analysis and development for new or improved autonomous systems and technologies. Develop engineering plans, system design plans, and requirements analysis for unmanned capabilities. Research and recommend communication networking and infrastructure strategies for autonomous systems. R&D and Engineering Analysis: * Perform research and development in open architecture, sensor integration, network design, and data processing. Conduct engineering analysis, AoAs, and risk mitigation recommendations for hardware and software integration. Collaborate with Government designers and engineers to resolve design and implementation challenges. Qualifications: * Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or related field (Master's degree preferred). 13+ years of experience in C4ISR systems integration, cybersecurity, and autonomous technologies. Strong expertise in open architecture, sensor integration, network design, and data processing. Experience with rapid prototyping, testing, and field deployment of communications and sensor systems. Knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks, vulnerability assessments, and risk management strategies. Individual may require 8140 / 8570 baseline certifications based on actual job duties. Active Secret clearance Contract Award expected Summer 2024. Positions are contingent upon award and funding. Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 Basic Compensation: $117,990 - $176,985 The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity. Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance. Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development. KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Maximum lifting, occasional lift/carry of small articles. Some occasional walking or standing may be required. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally, and all other sedentary criteria are met. Physical RequirementsStand or Sit; Walk; Repetitive Motion; Use Hands / Fingers to Handle or Feel; Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl; See; Climb (stairs, ladders) or Balance (ascend / descend, work atop, traverse). Employees of Agile Defense are our number one priority, and the importance we place on our culture here is fundamental. Our culture is alive and evolving, but it always stays true to its roots. Here, you are valued as a family member, and we believe that we can accomplish great things together. Agile Defense has been highly successful in the past few years due to our employees and the culture we create together. We believe several attributes are the root of our very best employees and extraordinary culture. We have named these attributes "The 6 H's" - Happy, Helpful, Honest, Humble, Hungry, and Hustle. Happy : We exhibit a positive outlook in order to create a positive environment. Helpful : We assist each other and pull together as teammates to deliver. Honest : We conduct our business with integrity. Humble : We recognize that success is not achieved alone, that there is always more to learn, and that no task is below us. Hungry : We desire to consistently improve. Hustle : We work hard and get after it. These Core Values are present in all our employees and our organization's aspects. Learn more about us and our culture by visiting us here. COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements Agile Defense is subject to federal vaccine mandates or other customer/facility vaccination requirements as a federal contractor. As such, to protect its employees' health and safety and comply with customer requirements, Agile Defense may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with DisabilitiesThe contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Systems Software Programmer
job_description: Job Description:  Pay Range $60hr - $65hr  Responsibilities:       Lead The Development Of A Secured Provider Portal Qualified Providers Who Provide Services Under The Families First Prevention Services Act (Ffpsa). Develop And Modify Vb/Asp.Net And C# Code That Accesses A Ms Sql 2019 Database. title: Embedded Software Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: The employee will fill the technical position of Embedded Software Engineer on the Software Defined Radio Systems (SDRS) program at the Navy Information Warfare Center (NIWC) Atlantic in Charleston, SC. This individual will work alongside industry experts in the fields of SDR, software development, and tactical communications. The expected role will emphasize all aspects of embedded software development including documentation, design, implementation, integration, verification, review, tool chain automation, etc. Performs development of applications, tools, drivers, etc. for embedded Linux ARM64 systems Designs communications between distributed software components Performs Integration and debugging with other system software/firmware Designs and development of tests and test tools Automates software with scripts Performs system demonstrations 0-15% CONUS travel required Requirements MINIMUM SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience Solid, demonstrable experience in embedded Linux software development Experience with embedded development on ARM-based architectures Experience with embedded OS development such as Yocto, Buildroot, or PetaLinux Fluent in C/C++, standard libraries, etc., and able to learn new languages Experienced with debuggers and learning/searching preexisting codebases for problems and solutions Comfortable working in Linux operating environments (CentOS) Familiar with GCC or Clang toolchain Highly motivated and able to work independently and in a team Effective complex problem solving skills Effective communication and analysis skills Formal education or equivalent experience in a systems or software engineering disciplineDESIRED SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: Experience with Software Defined Radio (SDR) platforms or software Experience in Go programming language Experienced with scripting languages such as Bash or Python Hands-on experience working with CMOSS, SOSA, MORA or similar Familiar with creating OOT modules for GNU Radio or RedHawk SDR Familiar with containerization—Kubernetes, Docker, Vagrant, Ansible Familiar with Software Communications Architecture (SCA) and Object Request Brokers (ORBs)SRC IS A CONTRACTOR FOR THE U.S. GOVERNMENT, THIS POSITION WILL REQUIRE U.S. CITIZENSHIP AS WELL AS, A U.S. GOVERNMENT SECURITY CLEARANCE AT THE SECRET LEVEL ABOUT US Scientific Research Corporation is an advanced information technology and engineering company that provides innovative products and services to government and private industry, as well as independent institutions. At the core of our capabilities is a seasoned team of highly skilled engineers and scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds. This team is challenged daily to provide cutting edge technology solutions to our clients. Scientific Research Corporation offers a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages excellence. For positions requiring a security clearance, selected applicants will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. DIVERSITY & INCLUSION We strongly believe in the abundance of differences among individuals. We value different points of view and appreciate diverse perspectives. We truly believe this is what makes our organization inclusive and more responsive to the needs of our diverse customers. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Scientific Research Corporation is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate in employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Scientific Research Corporation endeavors to make www.scires.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact for assistance. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. [#CJ ]

title: Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Athenix Special Missions (ASM) is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer at the Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support (MTCCS)-Centers of Excellence (COE) Schools at Fort Jackson, SC. ASM Quality Policy: To meet or exceed customers' expectation for quality, delivery, and service through continual improvement, striving to meet our objectives, and committing to meeting all legal and statutory requirements. Summary: Athenix Special Missions is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer to provide Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support II (MTCCS) technical and functional Constructive Simulation and Gaming support to TRADOC Centers of Excellence (COE) and Schools. This work provides technical and functional end-to-end (simulation to Mission Command Systems (MCS)) training functionality using TRADOC Proponent OfficeConstructive (TPO-C) low overhead simulations and TRADOC Proponent OfficeVirtual & Gaming (TPO-V&G) games. Simulations and tools such as Army Games for Training (GFT), Virtual Battle Space (VBS), and Division eXercise Training and Review System (DXTRS) are employed to enhance staff training at the lower continuum of training thresholds with the purpose of enhancing Military Decision Making Process (MDMP) and staff training in each respective TRADOC Institutions training curriculum. Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:Shall be available between 08001700 hrs, Monday through Friday except Federal holidays or when the government facility is closed for administrative reasons.Provide assistance and support with the necessary resources for planning, preparation, setup, operation, troubleshooting of the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS hardware and software applications and functionality to support the following tasks:Preparation, setup and operation of the closed networks supporting the TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications.Preparation, setup and operation of the unclassified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the classified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the DIS component between applications.Provide exercise preparation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide exercise execution for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide unit database and scenario builds that includes planning, building, and loading, configuring and operating TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications/tools.MDMP preparation, setup and operation using TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS ToolsProvide end to end functional preparation, setup and operations from the simulation/tool to include the MCS.Provide terrain preparation, setup and operation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G terrain tools.Provide TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS troubleshooting expertise when technical and operational issues occur.When a TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS issue/deficiency is identified, troubleshoot a work-around and submit a Problem Trouble Report (PTR) to TPO-C using the PTR Tool located on the NSC SharePoint Site.Provide support to all simulations in support of other exercises, training events, and planning.Provide support to LVC-G and other simulations, as requested.Serve as a systems and network administrator. This task includes all computer and network functions and infrastructure affecting the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS tools.Develop and provide written records (meetings, conference, working groups, after action reports, etc.) for each supported exercise/event.Provide testing and validation support to the capability and material development of the TPO-C tools.Provide operational and functional support of the MCS.Develop and provide briefing/presentation for each supported exercise/event as required by the OSCOR.Develop and provide Exercise Technical Summary Report for each supported exercise/event.When required, provide TPO-C and TPO-V&G support to other than COE/Schools.Provide computer networking support.Maintain training content; update the MilGaming web site and its content: graphics, animations, scenarios, models, terrain, training support packages (TSPs), and videos.Installation, Operation, and Maintenance of TPO-C and TPO-V&G Applications; this includes troubleshooting and resolving TPO-C and TPO-V&G software, hardware and network problem, real-time editing, and backup/recovery of all TPO-C and TPO-V&G data elements.Configuration Management; Maintain TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications. Manage version control and continuous integration, for all configuration management requirements.Install, Configure and operate existing and Emerging Army Stimulation-to- command and control (C2) interfaces; configure TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, and peripheral equipment to interface with Army Stimulation MCS interfaces as required.Administer the TPO-C and TPO-V&G systems during exercises and training events; participate in After Action Reviews (AARs) IAW TC 25-20, manage the TPO-C and TPO-V&G security compliance activities, to include the design and development of TPO-C and TPO-V&G information technology (IT) strategies at the local level.Maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G furnished equipment; maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, peripheral equipment, MCS equipment that may be issued by others and other simulation related items.Participate in required TPO-C and TPO-V&G /Mission Command Training Support Program (MCTSP) program review; participate in exercise readiness review, initial planning reviews, systems requirements reviews, software and hardware specification and design reviews, and participates in TPO-C and TPO-V&G user conferences/developer working groups.Instruct training audience and personnel to operate TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS systems and tools. Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree or experience equivalent in technical disciplines such as engineering, mathematics, statistics, and related computer sciences in performing capability development and Repair and Maintenance (RandM) tasks.Four years' experience in software development, simulation integration within the Microsoft Windows and Linux family of operating systems; to include expertise in hardware and software standards and protocols; ability to apply architectures to real world requirements using current Live, Virtual, Constructive and Gaming (LVC-G) platforms.Two years of experience in software testing, analysis, troubleshooting, problem trouble reports development, management and documentation (PTRs), and operating current gaming suite toolkit.Shall have the ability to write programs using C++, MFC, C#, Visual Basic, JAVA, XML, scripting languages, X programming and libraries and shall integrate networking packet protocols into simulation environments.Experience in providing technical advice for gaming development as it relates to the (LVC-G) Training Environment.Must be able to read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.Bachelor's degree or equivalent, any discipline, and three (3) years' experience in operating simulations, simulators, models, games and MCS.In lieu of a college degree, four (4) years' experience in database management and/or systems management on systems within JLCCTC, GFT and MCS may be substituted for a bachelor's degree. Clearance: Requires a Secret clearance Location: National Simulation Center, Fort Leavenworth, KS / Fort Liberty, NC / JBSA, TX / Fort Novosel, AL / Fort Sill, OK / Fort Moore, GA / Fort Leonard Wood, MO / Fort Gordon, GA / Fort Gregg-Adams, VA / Fort Bliss, TX / Fort Jackson, SC / Fort Huachuca, AZ / Carlisle Barracks, PA / Charlottesville, VA / West Point, NY / Monterey Bay, CA Travel: Travel may be required MTCCS II_Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer_Questionnaire, 27 AUG 2023Do you possess a Secret security clearance? Please explain.Do you possess a bachelor's degree or experience equivalent in technical disciplines such as engineering, mathematics, statistics, and related computer sciences in performing capability development and Repair and Maintenance (RandM) tasks? Please explain.Do you possess four years' experience in software development, simulation integration within the Microsoft Windows and Linux family of operating systems; to include expertise in hardware and software standards and protocols; ability to apply architectures to real world requirements using current Live, Virtual, Constructive and Gaming (LVC-G) platforms? Please explain.Do you possess two years of experience in software testing, analysis, troubleshooting, problem trouble reports development, management and documentation (PTRs), and operating current gaming suite toolkit? Please explain.Do you have the ability to write programs using C++, MFC, C#, Visual Basic, JAVA, XML, scripting languages, X programming and libraries and shall integrate networking packet protocols into simulation environments? Please explain.Do you possess experience in providing technical advice for gaming development as it relates to the (LVC-G) Training Environment? Please explain.Do you possess three (3) years' experience in operating simulations, simulators, models, games and MCS? Please explain.Do you possess four (4) years' experience in database management and/or systems management on systems within JLCCTC, GFT and MCS? Please explain.Are you able to read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language? Please explain. Athenix Solutions Group, LLC and its companies Athenix Cyber and SIGINT, and Athenix Special Missions is an EEO/Affirmative action employer and is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Technical Systems Engineer (Electronic Security)
job_description: Company OverviewGlobal Guardian is a provider of world-class security solutions, custom-tailored to the individual needs of its global client base. The company offers an integrated suite of best-in-class security services that help clients identify and mitigate the risks of traveling and doing business both overseas and domestically.Global Guardian offers a full range of security services, both domestically and overseas. These services include personnel tracking, emergency response, security and transportation support, intelligence and due diligence medical support, emergency and custom aviation, cyber security, and video surveillance monitoring. Global Guardian seamlessly integrates as many of these capabilities as needed and delivers them 24 hours a day under the close guidance of its Operations Center.At Global Guardian, our clients' safety and satisfaction is our top priority. We are hyper-responsive and dedicated to providing world-class service. Our Operations Center staff and local teams move in minutes and hours.Position OverviewThe Technical Systems Engineer will own the work they perform and contribute to the growth of the organization as we scale into a true global provider of electronic security services, providing turnkey, white glove, services to our clientele. The Technical Systems Engineer plans, executes, monitors, controls, and delivers the completed project to our clients, start to finish. Their technical skills and experience in the electronic security industry will prove valuable to their success. They will be a core member of the team; customer facing, results driven, and ensuring the protection of people, property, and product.Duties And ResponsibilitiesEnsure that all assigned installation and service projects are managed properly in accordance with Global Guardian Asset Security Technology policies and procedures.Manages and supports subcontractors and other trade partners. Prepare, monitor, and manage projects and project plans, and provide training where required.Manages client expectations and contractual obligations.Perform Installation and Service of various video, access control, locking hardware, intrusion, intercom, and other low voltage systems to ensure delivery to contract/scope of work as outlined in project documentation.Configure, test, and commission network and other communications equipment to confirm connectivity locally and at GSOC for monitoring.Maintain a high level of programming knowledge in IP Video Surveillance Systems, Access Control Systems, and related technologies.Interface with voice, telecommunications, and network personnel in support of SOC hardware, services, and vendors as needed.Manage and or support special projects, as needed.Complete other tasks as assigned.Provide on-call support and response as needed. Remote or physical response as necessary dependent of client and issue.QualificationsMinimum five (5) years’ experience in electronic security field in technician role.High School Diploma or GED required; College degree in technology/network related field preferred.Must be at least 18 years of age.Must have a reliable means of transportation.Must have the legal right to work in the United States.Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English.Low voltage systems certifications preferred.State low voltage licensed preferred.Experience with various security system platforms and related equipment including, but not limited, to NVRs, cameras, access control systems, intrusion systems, fire alarm systems, intercom systems, and respective software (Avigilon, Hanwha, Axis, Milestone, Exacq Vision, Lenel, S2, Ademco, DMP, Bosch, Alarm.com)A general understanding of IP addressing.Ability to write technical documentation and markup job documentation/plans.Ability to organize and perform job duties within a constantly changing environment.Works independently with the ability to make decisions on demand to meet customers' expectations.Experience with firewalls such as Fortinet, networking equipment (routers and switches)Ability to analyze data and services and make appropriate recommendations to improve service/reduce cost.Ability to effectively troubleshoot and accurately resolve problems.General knowledge in Microsoft Office Programs including, but not limited to MS Word, MS Excel, MS OutlookExcellent planning, organization, and time management skillsSkill in clear and concise oral and written communicationAbility to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagrammatic, or schedule form.Ability to understand and follow company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations.Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with internal and external clients and/or associates. Work Environment & ScheduleClient sites residential, commercial, and industrialRegular travel, local and national and for extended durations. Potential to stay over weekends where necessary.Flexibility to work beyond regular working hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. Varying shifts and extended hours. Occasional weekend work.Ability to lift and maneuver equipment overhead weighing upwards of 50 lbs.Ability to operate lifts and/or work at extension ladder heights to conduct installations.Ability to enter crawl spaces and/or attic spaces for cable pathway and/or device installation.EeoUS applicants: Global Guardian is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call 1-800-381-2761, or contact us at basinhumanresources@basinholdings.com.Powered by JazzHR

title: Internet / Web Engineer
job_description: Only W2 Profiles, No C2C CandidatesJob Description: SCOPE OF THE PROJECT:Due to the volume of systems, interdependencies, servers, and various locations throughout the state, additional staff is needed to support the effort. The team will ensure systems are set up following industry best practices to ensure strategic initiatives and compliance with federal and state regulatory laws and ensure business continuity.This position will be a part of the team responsible for the implementation of this project. They will also be involved with supporting the day-to-day operations.Candidates should be self-motivated, team-oriented, work under limited supervision, and respond to priority tasks as needed.Daily Duties / ResponsibilitiesEmphases for the Web/Internet candidate will be to assist with support of our Office 365 GCC environment to include Teams, Teams telephony, Dynamics, Power Bi dashboards, Power Apps, modification to sites, forms, and workflow. To include user permissions, user support, and day-to-day operations.Specific duties and responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following: Assist with Office 365 Government G5 environment, permissions, and security. Knowledge of Dynamics and assist as needed. Support of Teams Telephony and setup. Use BMC Footprints and resolve any assigned tickets. Provide user support to support daily operations. Troubleshoot and resolve production issues Reviews and monitoring usage reports Utilization of PowerApss Deploy custom developed Dynamic and third-party solution packages Programming JavaScript, JQuery, and powershell Support PowerBI dashboards. Monitor systems for uptime and ensure online. Create supporting project and system documentation. Provide updates to the Project Team. Work in a collaborative effort to conceptualize total systems and/or product solutions currently in place. Ability to plan, organize, review, implement associated project milestones to completion. Creates architecture diagrams, and technology navigation maps. Assist with development of policies and procedures to conform and comply with agency standard cyber security policy design related to information risk management, designation of data as to criticality, confidentiality, and protection. (NIST 800-53, FISMA, SC InfoSec Requirements http://admin.sc.gov/technology/information-security/policies-and-procedures, etc.)The position will be utilized for 40 hours per week for the duration of this project. The selected candidate should be able to work flexible hours where it may be necessary for work to be completed outside traditional business hours.The candidate will work closely with the Assigned Section Manager to identify, prioritize, and schedule workload and implementation to IT standards and procedures. The candidate will work closely with customer and subject matter experts for the system design and testing.This will also include compliance to DHEC security policy/procedures as well as integrating systems when possible to streamline staff workflows, user security, and data correction.Module support of the project. DHEC will require that selected personnel sign the DHEC confidentially agreement and/or Business Associate (BA) agreement if applicable. All web services must be secure. DHEC will not accept any offers including an “up-lift” charge. The rate paid per consultant must not exceed the maximum rate established for this position described in the State contract terms. Contractors must be onsite during each week throughout the term of the contract. Follow agency IT Standards, policies, and procedures to include documentation. All source code (compiled and un-compiled) will become the sole property of the South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control. Any source code, data, product, or functionality resulting from this SOW or previously owned/developed by DHEC will remain the sole property of DHEC and is not to be incorporated into the core product of any vendor's application. Any modifications and interfaces developed under said contract will be not be used by the contractor for any independent project of the contractor or published or publicized by the contractor without written permission of DHEC. DHEC has the final say on all programming choices.Payment ScheduleAll timesheets shall be entered and approved in a timely manner per State contract terms. The State will not pay any extra costs (i.e. Travel, employee benefits, insurance, room and board, etc.) for temporary employees under this contract.DHEC SupportDHEC will provide: All required information including formulas, data, and mechanisms to check output. Staff to assist with any application or data questions. Conference rooms and scheduling for any application demos. Workstation and required software.Required Skills (rank In Order Of Importance) MS Dynamics 365 PowerApps Workflow design and implementation MS SQL Microsoft Active Directory Ticketing systems CSS, HTML, JavaScript, XML, RSS Power Bi Experience with security and data classification related to CDC, HIPAA, and CJISPreferred Skills (rank In Order Of Importance) M365 TEAMS Experience with security and data classification related to CDC, HIPAA, and CJIS. Ability to establish positive working relationships with technical staff, customers and others involved in data-centric management. Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills Knowledge of Information Technology Field, best practices, organization and operations Ability to integrate technical systems with agency goals and objectives.REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a relevant field of work or equivalent work experience.

title: PeopleSoft Developer
job_description: Hi,Please let me know your interest for the position below. Also share your Updated resumePhone/Skype Hire. Upto 75% remote.Location: Clemson, SCDuration: 12+ monthsResponsibilitiesProgramming:Serves as analyst on moderately complex critical or auxiliary systems. Designs, codes, tests, documents, implements, and troubleshoots moderately complex programs, program modifications, or applications based on specifications or contract with the customer. Ensures that all work is timely, accurate, and in compliance with departmental or project standards.Application AnalysisLeads the analysis of business requirements and designs technical solutions to implement changes. Communicates with users to gather information, coordinates the testing and migration of moderately complex applications to production, and provides related customer training for those applications. Learns the business rules, technical design, and production requirements of complex subsystems. title: Cyber Software Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Number 661800BR Description:Our collaborative cyber test and training teams define one-of-a-kind solutions tailored to the cyber warfighter. These teams deliver actionable results to increase the cyber resiliency of our nation's most important systems. Our Cyber and Intelligence group is seeking a Software Engineer with a flexible skillset who enjoys learning new technologies to join its cyber range team. The successful candidate will lead the development, enhancement, and maintenance of a set of cyber test tools used to design and execute cyber testing and training events. The Software Engineer will be responsible for all aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle in regards to running Cyber Test and Training Events - ensuring that our software solutions meet government cyber testing needs. The Software Engineer should have a background in automation, system administration, software development including scripting, and basic understanding of other various computing and cyber topics. Responsibilities include: Own the software development process Identify and lead Digital Transformation initiatives Maintain multiple baselines Contribute to schedule and cost baseline development Metrics tracking and reporting Develop and maintain productivity/estimating data Coordinate software enhancement needs with Cyber Event Designers and Leads Represent software in customer interactions Support of technical and programmatic reviews Architectural and software design review and input Obsolescence identification and remediation/development This position may be eligible to receive up to a $20,000 sign-on bonus! Must be eligible to receive a TS/SCI clearance.Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 9 years of professional experience; or 7 years of professional experience with a related Masters degree with a focus in computer science, or a focus in computer and information sciences, information technology, management information systems, or a related discipline with corresponding experience and demonstrated mastery of relevant computer science and software engineering topics. Prior usage or knowledge of infrastructure configuration automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Salt, etc. 3+ years of experience with software development and software engineering (can overlap with other experience). Must be eligible to receive a TS/SCI clearance.Desired Skills Expert knowledge of: software development to include agile software development practices; programming languages; operating systems; networks; enterprise and consumer IT concepts, architectures, and systems (computer, network, storage). Expert knowledge of PowerShell, bash scripting, python scripting, and C/C++ development. Experience developing or modifying web applications using web development frameworks such as Django, Ruby on Rails, Flask, Angular, Bottle, jQuery, Meteor. Prior usage or knowledge of one or more continuous integration tools such as Jenkins. Prior usage or knowledge of one or more of the following MySQL, MariaDB, mongoDB, Postgres SQL, or no SQL. Knowledge of Networking protocols such as TCP/IP, HTTP, HTTPS, TFTP, DNS, FTP. 2+ years of experience with cyber testing or training to include experience with defensive and offensive cyber tools and TTPs or relevant experience (can overlap with other experience). 2+ years of systems administration experience (can overlap with other experience).Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.Clearance Level: SecretOther Important Information You Should KnowExpression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.Schedule for this Position: Non- standard 40 hour work week as assigned by leaderLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.The application window will close in 90 days; applicants are encouraged to apply within 5 - 30 days of the requisition posting date in order to receive optimal consideration.Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They're dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin's vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers' toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.Experience Level: Experienced ProfessionalBusiness Unit: RMSRelocation Available: NoCareer Area: Cyber Security EngineeringType: Task Order/IDIQShift: First

title: Sr. Software Engineer, Full Stack .Net
job_description: About The RoleGrade Level (for internal use):10The TeamWe are excited to announce an opening for a full-stack application developer role in our dynamic team. Our team works with other developers on our platform, and as a member of our team, you will get the opportunity to work with people from diverse backgrounds and develop a close team dynamic with coworkers from around the world. As a full-stack developer, you will be responsible for developing the products that our clients use daily by utilizing your technical knowledge and analytical skills. You will also help provide mentorship and insight to other developers while stretching your knowledge as we come up with new solutions to the challenges we encounter.Responsibilities And ImpactIn this role, you will be working with data and analytics that provide the foundation for every day decisions in the capital and commodities markets. Experienced on enterprise web development projects or applications.Strong command of essential technologies: C#, SQL Server, JavaScript frameworks (JQuery, React.Js, Knockout.js/ Angular.js). Proficient with software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies like Agile, Test- driven development. Good experience with developing solutions involving relational database technologies on SQL Server platform.Strong communications skills with ability to communicate with international teams. Additional Preferred Qualifications Production development in .Net coreStrong database skills on RDBMS and NoSqlAbout S&P Global Market IntelligenceAt S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.Our ValuesIntegrity, Discovery, PartnershipAt S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.BenefitsWe take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.Our Benefits IncludeHealth & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. title: F5 Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: acuCyber is seeking an F5 Engineer with experience administrating application delivery networking solutions including local load balancing and acceleration, global (DNS based) load balancing and acceleration, security through web application firewall and application authentication and access products for both datacenter and cloud applications. The ideal candidate would be versed in administration of the F5 BIG-IP LTM, BIP-IP DNS, APM, ASM, Reverse Web Proxy (RWP) to include Department of Defense (DoD) Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) application authentication and SSL break and inspect, networking, virtualization, and security best practices. The candidate will be expected to have a general understanding of data center design concepts and subsystems (i.e. storage, network, security, orchestration/automation, backup, disaster recovery) as they relate to application delivery networking solutions deployed across geographically dispersed private data centers and commercial public cloud platforms (such as AWS, Azure). The candidate will join a team of engineers and administrators and work in a collaborative multi-functional team environment. Relevant network and security certifications are required. Roles and Responsibilities: -Perform routine administrative and maintenance functions (install, configure, patch, update, etc.) F5 platforms. -Support and creation of iRules on F5 Load balancers. -Creation of Virtual Servers, Pools, iRules, Nodes, etc. -Creation of Monitors, Address Translations, and Traffic Class. -Creation of Device Groups and Device Trust with Trust, CA Certificates, Identity Certificates, and Traffic Groups.Configure Network parameters including, interfaces, Routes, Self IP’s, Packet Filters, Trunks, Tunnels, VLANs, etc. -Configure system parameters including, Configuration, Device Certificates, File/Disk/Software Management, License Updates, Users, etc. -Management and creation of SSL certificates, both self-signed and third party signed, within the application environment. -Perform security hardening and work with IA/C&A teams to conduct security scans/audits. -Troubleshoot F5 platforms in preproduction and production environments. -Monitor performance of remote and local systems to identify problems, and if needed, perform analysis to identify root cause of any performance issues and take appropriate corrective action to resolve issues. -Develop scripts to automate manual tasks. -Work with application owners and infrastructure team members (network, storage, IA, etc.) to optimize system performance. -Participate in the development and maintenance of system lifecycle documentation. Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Desired/Required Skills: -BS degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or Computer Science/Information Systems Technology and minimum of 6 years industry IT experience or Technical Training in relevant enterprise hosting technology areas and 10 years hands on DoD industry IT Experience. -5+ years of network experience working in data center or enterprise environments is desired. -2+ years of experience with F5 platforms is required. -Experience with F5 and creation of application specific iRules is required. -Secret clearance or higher preferred8570 compliance (Active Security and OS certifications)Experience in managing SSL certificates is required. -Strong log analysis and troubleshooting skills are required. -Experience with network monitoring/management platforms. -Strong written and oral communication skills. -Ability to work cooperatively in a multi-functional team environment (team player) is required. -Compliance with current government cybersecurity workforce requirements (current relevant network and security certifications) is required. -Additional network related certifications are desired. -Additional security related certifications are desired. -Experience with DoD security requirements is desired. -Experience with network management and monitoring tools. Other requirements: -Exposure to and familiarity with data center design including systems, storage and networking. A strong sense of urgency including self-governance on task priority.

title: Lead Data Analyst
job_description: Immediate need for a talented Lead Data Analyst . This is a 12+ Months Contract opportunity with long-term potential and is located in Columbia, SC(Onsite). Please review the job description below and contact me ASAP if you are interested.Job ID: 24-11319Pay Range: $46.74/hour.  Employee benefits include, but are not limited to, health insurance (medical, dental, vision), 401(k) plan, and paid sick leave (depending on work location).Note: As a part of our hiring process, along with an option to directly connect with a Recruiter or apply online, we now offer a texting option to enhance your candidate experience.  Click the link below which contains a few basic questions that will help you ensure this is a good fit and expedite the shortlisting process:https://hire.glider.ai/connect/47416577Key Responsibilities:Serves in a lead capacity as an expert data analyst and may also lead a team. Creates and analyzes reports to support operations. Presents report findings in a concise manner to appropriate management level. Directly responsible for accuracy of data as financial and operational decisions are made based on the data provided. 40% Reviews, extracts and analyzes data to be used in formulation of procedures, processes and other requirements, including data integrity and quality control. Provides reports of relevant activity to be used to identify problematic areas and data anomalies, in order to provide basis for modification and/or elimination of operations issues. Revises existing reports and develops new reports based on changing methodologies. Analyzes reports to ensure accuracy and quality. Tracks and verifies all reporting statistics and/or metrics. 30% Develops complex analysis and sophisticated data compilation, verification, and interpretations to guide divisional efforts.
